content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
julia> df = DataFrame(dt=[Date("2015-08-14"), Date("2016-10-30")])
2×1 DataFrames.DataFrame
│ Row │ dt       │
├─────┼──────────┤
│ 1   │ 2015-08-14 │
│ 2   │ 2016-10-30 │

julia> add_yearmonth(df, "dt", "ym")
2×2 DataFrames.DataFrame
│ Row │ dt       │ ym  │
├─────┼──────────┼─────┤
│ 1   │ 2015-08-14 │ 201508 │
│ 2   │ 2016-10-30 │ 201610 │
```

### Solution
```julia
function add_yearmonth(df, dt_col, ym_col)
    insertcols!(df, Symbol(ym_col) => map(x -> x.year * 100 + x.month, df[!,Symbol(dt_col)]))
end
```
